name: Energy
description: The energy provided by food, typically measured in kilocalories.
source_notes: Primary energy value. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1008 (Energy) and FDC Nutrient Number 208.

name: Protein
description: Macronutrient essential for building muscle mass and other bodily functions. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1003 (Protein) and FDC Nutrient Number 203.

name: Carbohydrate
description: Macronutrient that is the body's main source of energy. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1005 (Carbohydrate, by difference) and FDC Nutrient Number 205.

name: Fat
description: Macronutrient essential for energy storage, insulation, and absorption of fat-soluble vitamins. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1004 (Total lipid (fat)) and FDC Nutrient Number 204.

name: Sugar
description: Total sugars including those naturally present and added. NLEA: Nutrition Labeling and Education Act. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 2000 (Sugars, total including NLEA).
source_notes: This is often the value used for 'Total Sugars' on nutrition labels.

name: Fiber
description: Indigestible part of plant foods that aids in digestion and has various health benefits. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1079 (Fiber, total dietary) and FDC Nutrient Number 291.

name: Calcium
description: Mineral essential for bone health, muscle function, and nerve transmission. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1087 (Calcium, Ca) and FDC Nutrient Number 301.

name: Sodium
description: Mineral essential for fluid balance and nerve function. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1093 (Sodium, Na) and FDC Nutrient Number 307.

name: Potassium
description: Mineral important for heart function, nerve signaling, and muscle contraction. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1092 (Potassium, K) and FDC Nutrient Number 306.

name: Magnesium
description: Mineral involved in over 300 enzymatic reactions, including energy production and muscle function. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1090 (Magnesium, Mg) and FDC Nutrient Number 304.

name: Phosphorus
description: Mineral critical for bone structure, cell membrane integrity, and energy metabolism. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1091 (Phosphorus, P) and FDC Nutrient Number 305.

name: Sulfur
description: Mineral component of essential amino acids and antioxidants. Often not tracked directly due to estimation via protein intake. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1094 (Sulfur, S).

name: Zinc
description: Trace mineral essential for immune function, wound healing, DNA synthesis, and enzyme activity. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1095 (Zinc, Zn) and FDC Nutrient Number 309.

name: Iodine
description: Trace element critical for the production of thyroid hormones, which regulate metabolism and growth. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1100 (Iodine, I) and FDC Nutrient Number 312.

name: Selenium
description: Trace mineral with antioxidant properties and roles in thyroid function and immune defense. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1103 (Selenium, Se) and FDC Nutrient Number 317.

name: Copper
description: Trace mineral involved in iron metabolism, connective tissue formation, and neurotransmitter synthesis. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1098 (Copper, Cu) and FDC Nutrient Number 312.

name: Iron
description: Mineral essential for oxygen transport in the blood. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1089 (Iron, Fe) and FDC Nutrient Number 303.

name: Vitamin A
description: Fat-soluble vitamin important for vision, immune function, and cell growth. Measured in Retinol Activity Equivalents. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1106 (Vitamin A, RAE) and FDC Nutrient Number 320.
source_notes: RAE is the preferred unit for Vitamin A activity.

name: Vitamin B1
description: B-vitamin critical for energy metabolism and proper nerve and muscle function. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1165 (Thiamin) and FDC Nutrient Number 404.

name: Vitamin B2
description: B-vitamin that supports cellular energy production and the metabolism of fats, drugs, and steroids. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1166 (Riboflavin) and FDC Nutrient Number 405.

name: Vitamin B3
description: B-vitamin essential for energy metabolism, DNA repair, and cell signaling. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1167 (Niacin) and FDC Nutrient Number 406.

name: Vitamin B5
description: B-vitamin vital for the synthesis of coenzyme A and for the metabolism of proteins, fats, and carbohydrates. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1170 (Pantothenic acid) and FDC Nutrient Number 410.

name: Vitamin B6
description: B-vitamin involved in amino-acid metabolism, neurotransmitter synthesis, and hemoglobin formation. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1175 (Vitamin B-6) and FDC Nutrient Number 415.

name: Vitamin B7
description: B-vitamin important for macronutrient metabolism, gene regulation, and healthy hair, skin, and nails. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1176 (Biotin) and FDC Nutrient Number 417.

name: Vitamin B9
description: B-vitamin important for cell growth and metabolism. DFE: Dietary Folate Equivalents. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1190 (Folate, DFE) and FDC Nutrient Number 435.
source_notes: DFE accounts for differences in bioavailability between food folate and folic acid.

name: Vitamin B12
description: B-vitamin required for red-blood-cell formation, neurological function, and DNA synthesis. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1178 (Vitamin B-12) and FDC Nutrient Number 418.

name: Vitamin D
description: Fat-soluble vitamin essential for calcium absorption and bone health. Includes D2 (ergocalciferol) and D3 (cholecalciferol). Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1114 (Vitamin D (D2 + D3)) and FDC Nutrient Number 328.
source_notes: Often also expressed in IU (International Units), where 1 µg = 40 IU.

name: Vitamin E
description: Fat-soluble antioxidant vitamin that protects cell membranes from oxidative damage. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1109 (Vitamin E) and FDC Nutrient Number 323.

name: Vitamin K
description: Fat-soluble vitamin essential for the synthesis of blood-clotting factors and bone proteins. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1185 (Vitamin K) and FDC Nutrient Number 430.

name: Cholesterol
description: A type of lipid found in animal cells; high levels in blood are a risk factor for heart disease. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1253 (Cholesterol) and FDC Nutrient Number 601.

name: Choline
description: Essential nutrient important for liver function, brain development, nerve function. Corresponds to FDC Nutrient ID 1180 (Choline, total) and FDC Nutrient Number 421.
